DataElement.preferredName: Hearing And/Or Auditory Impairment Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score Assessment Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the hearing or auditory impairment neurologic function scale domain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hearing And/Or Auditory Impairment Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Of or relating to the process of hearing._Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function._A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hearing Impairment And/Or Auditory Impairment Raymond Neurologic Function Scale Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Of or relating to the process of hearing.:Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.:A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to the outer, middle, or inner ear structures. Causes include exposure to loud noise, ear infections, injuries to the ear, genetic, and congenital disorders.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Of or relating to the process of hearing.
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.
A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Neurologic Function Scale Assessment Score Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A 25-point scale used to evaluate the severity of gross neurologic dysfunction by scoring 15 disabilities across multiple domains._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A 25-point scale used to evaluate the severity of gross neurologic dysfunction by scoring 15 disabilities across multiple domains.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
